headline: Caesars Entertainment swings to fourth-quarter profit on strong Las Vegas business
summary: The Reno, Nevada-based casino operator, active in both casino and online gambling segments, has seen a surge in occupancy at its Las Vegas properties.  "As we look ahead to 2025, the brick and mortar operating environment remains stable and we are expecting another year of strong growth in our Digital segment," said CEO Tom Reeg.  Earlier this month, Wynn Resorts also beat analysts' estimates for fourth-quarter results, driven by strong business in Las Vegas and other regional properties.

Earlier this month, Wynn Resorts also beat analysts' estimates for fourth-quarter results, driven by strong business in Las Vegas and other regional properties.

headline: Freeport-McMoRan, AMC, Caesars: After-Hours Movers
summary: Asking for a Trend's Josh Lipton tracks the biggest stock moves in Tuesday's extended hours: Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) shares are rising after President Trump is looking into possibly imposing tariffs on copper (HG=F) imports. AMC Entertainment (AMC) reports a beat on fourth quarter revenue estimates, lifting the meme stock in after-hours trading. Lastly, casino operator Caesars Entertainment (CZR) slumps after falling short of same-store net revenue expectations. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend here. This post was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

headline: Caesars Entertainment (CZR) Beats Q4 Earnings Estimates
summary: Caesars Entertainment (CZR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of 133.33% and 0.40%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2024. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) Reports Sales Below Analyst Estimates In Q4 Earnings
summary: Hotel and casino entertainment company Caesars Entertainment (NASDAQ:CZR) fell short of the market’s revenue expectations in Q4 CY2024, with sales flat year on year at $2.80 billion. Its GAAP profit of $0.05 per share was significantly above analysts’ consensus estimates.
